citations.narrative:
Records of acquisition and disposition for the animals were not available for review at the time of inspection. These
records ensure traceability and accountability for animals obtained or disposed of by the facility. The facility must ensure
that acquisition and disposition records are kept and available for review.
Correct by July 30, 2023

The rabbit's water bottle had a buildup of dark particulate matter around the base of the bottle. Dirty water bottles with
visible foreign materials and biofilm can contaminate water intended for drinking and may be detrimental to the animal's
welfare. The facility must ensure that watering receptacles are sanitized when dirty.
Correct by July 21, 2023.

The large cage had a dirty towel on the floor, old soiled hay in half of the cage, old previously wetted feed in the hopper,
and a minor buildup of excreta on the wire. Periodic and routine cleaning to removed soiled materials and excreta
prevents buildup of bacteria and molds that may harbor disease causing agents detrimental to the rabbit's welfare. The
facility must ensure primary enclosures are routinely cleaned and maintained in a sanitary condition.
Correct by July 21,2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
Records of acquisition and disposition for the animals were not available for review at the time of inspection. These 
records ensure traceability and accountability for animals obtained or disposed of by the facility. The facility must ensure 
that acquisition and disposition records are kept and available for review.  
 
Correct by July 30, 2023 
3.55 
   
Watering. 
The rabbit's water bottle had a buildup of dark particulate matter around the base of the bottle. Dirty water bottles with 
visible foreign materials and biofilm can contaminate water intended for drinking and may be detrimental to the animal's 
welfare. The facility must ensure that watering receptacles are sanitized when dirty.  
 
Correct by July 21, 2023. 
3.56(a) 
   
Sanitation. 
The large cage had a dirty towel on the floor, old soiled hay in half of the cage, old previously wetted feed in the hopper, 
and a minor buildup of excreta on the wire. Periodic and routine cleaning to removed soiled materials and excreta 
prevents buildup of bacteria and molds that may harbor disease causing agents detrimental to the rabbit's welfare. The 
facility must ensure primary enclosures are routinely cleaned and maintained in a sanitary condition. 
 
Correct by July 21,2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.

n
